facts.title: The Muscle Shoals Sound
facts.fact: In the late 1970s, Muscle Shoals produced more hit singles per capita than any other city in the world—including New York, Los Angeles, and Nashville.

facts.title: FAME Studios
facts.fact: FAME Studios opened in 1959 and became one of the first places in the American South where Black and white musicians recorded together during the Civil Rights era.
facts.source: Alabama Department of Archives and History

facts.title: Father of the Blues
facts.fact: W.C. Handy, known as the 'Father of the Blues,' was born in Florence in 1873. His 'Memphis Blues' (1912) is considered one of the first published blues songs.

facts.title: Wilson Dam
facts.fact: Wilson Dam was the largest dam in the world when completed in 1924. It became the first dam administered by the Tennessee Valley Authority in 1933.

facts.title: Florence Indian Mound
facts.fact: The Florence Indian Mound is the tallest domiciliary mound in the Tennessee Valley at 43 feet. It was built by the Copena culture between 100-500 CE—over 1,500 years ago.

facts.title: Helen Keller
facts.fact: Helen Keller was born at Ivy Green in Tuscumbia in 1880. The famous 'miracle' where Anne Sullivan taught her to communicate happened at the well pump on the property.

facts.title: The Swampers
facts.fact: The Muscle Shoals Rhythm Section, known as 'The Swampers,' were among the first musicians to own their own studio and control their own publishing. They're mentioned in Lynyrd Skynyrd's 'Sweet Home Alabama.'

facts.title: The Singing River
facts.fact: Native Americans called the Tennessee River 'the Singing River.' Local legend says that's the source of the musical magic in the Shoals.

legends.name: W.C. Handy
legends.title: Father of the Blues
legends.contribution: Composed 'Memphis Blues' and 'St. Louis Blues,' transforming folk music into the blues genre that birthed jazz and rock & roll.

legends.name: Helen Keller
legends.title: Author, Activist, Lecturer
legends.contribution: Overcame blindness and deafness to become a world-famous author, lecturer, and advocate for people with disabilities.

legends.name: Rick Hall
legends.title: Founder of FAME Studios
legends.contribution: Founded FAME Studios in 1959 and produced countless hit records that defined the Muscle Shoals Sound.

legends.name: Sam Phillips
legends.title: Founder of Sun Records
legends.contribution: Founded Sun Records in Memphis and discovered Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, Jerry Lee Lewis, and other rock & roll pioneers.

locations.name: Muscle Shoals
highlights: Hit Recording Capital of the World

locations.name: Sheffield
highlights: Muscle Shoals Sound Studio (3614 Jackson Highway)
